content.description: This route starts on a big, obvious hueco. Mantel up into the hueco, then move right and up toward the lip. The crux, for me, was the reach to the lip. Watch out for one of the upper crimps. This crimp flexes and could break off, so be careful. Climb down the south face. I used a big, awkward layback flake to get down.
content.location: This route is on the NE face of a large boulder down the hill (north) from the Picnic Boulder. The boulder's on the left side of the sandy creekbed when walking in from the road. There's a juniper tree to the right of the climb.

content.description: A uniquely shaped boulder, with a few possible lines, and a V2/3 on the south side. Good hands on very painful granite, move left to a good incut, and right hand up to a gritty sloper. Move left foot up to smear and right foot on right hand starting hold. Then move the  right hand back over to the left for a crip and left hand reaching over your right arm for another gritty sloper. Then match hands reach up and grab "OH MY GOD" holds and top out. Fun, but the granite is painful.
content.protection: Good landing, one pad, two if you should fall from top.
content.location: About a 10 minute hike north from the picnic boulder parking. On west side of the Midland Road.
